Whereas Jazz music originated in the United States in the
			 early part of the 20th century with roots in both African and European music
			 traditions, and has been characterized as the United States greatest musical
			 contribution to the world;

Whereas Ahmet Ertegün, the founder of the Atlantic
			 Records, and his brother Nesuhi, the sons of Turkey’s second Ambassador to the
			 United States, in the 1930s and 1940s organized the first-ever racially
			 integrated jazz concerts at the Turkish Embassy Residence at a time when
			 Washington, DC, was still segregated;
